intro: Racosperma anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, yellow pea-like flowers. The plant has bipinnate leaves that are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stem. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Racosperma anceps is a hardy shrub that plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
